text: M. Fathima Beevi (30 April 1927 - 23 November 2023) was an Indian lawyer and politician. She was a Judge of the Supreme Court of India. In 1989, she became the first female judge to be a part of the Supreme Court of India, She was a member of the National Human Rights Commission and later as the Governor of the Indian state of Tamil Nadu from 1997 to 2001. ==Death== Beevi died on 23 November 2023 in Kollam, India at the age of 96. ==References== Category:Indian judges Category:Governors of Tamil Nadu Category:1927 births Category:2023 deaths Category:Malayali people
title: Fathima Beevi
